modernize-avoid-c-style-cast.description:
Description

Finds usages of C-style casts.

C-style casts can perform a variety of different conversions (
const_cast
,
static_cast
,
reinterpret_cast
, or a combination). This makes them
dangerous as the intent is not clear, and they can silently perform unsafe
conversions between incompatible types.

This check is similar to
-Wold-style-cast
, but it suggests automated fixes
in some cases. The reported locations should not be different from the ones
generated by
-Wold-style-cast
.

Examples
class
A
{
public
:
std
::
string
v
;
};
A
a
;
double
*
num
=
(
double
*
)(
&
a
);
// Compiles! Hides danger
// num = static_cast<double*>(&a);     // Won't compile (good!)
num
=
reinterpret_cast
<
double
*>
(
&
a
);
// Compiles, danger is explicit

References
Corresponding cpplint.py check name:
readability/casting
.
modernize-avoid-c-style-cast.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
